Connection
----------

**Definition:** The process of linking different concepts, ideas, or skills together to build integrated understanding.

.. raw:: html

   <div class="glossary-entry">
     <div class="hint-container">
       <button class="hint-toggle" onclick="toggleHint('connection-examples')">Show Examples</button>
       <div class="hint-content" id="connection-examples" style="display: none;">
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Learning Example:</strong> Connecting multiplication to repeated addition helps students understand both concepts better.
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Problem-Solving Example:</strong> Connecting past experiences with current challenges helps you recognize patterns and apply successful strategies.
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Teaching Example:</strong> Connecting new information to what students already know makes learning more effective.
         </div>
       </div>
     </div>
   </div>

**Related terms:** Foundation, Synthesis, Transfer Learning

Foundation
----------

**Definition:** The essential building blocks or core elements that must be understood before tackling more complex concepts or problems.

.. raw:: html

   <div class="glossary-entry">
     <div class="hint-container">
       <button class="hint-toggle" onclick="toggleHint('foundation-examples')">Show Examples</button>
       <div class="hint-content" id="foundation-examples" style="display: none;">
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Academic Example:</strong> In mathematics, understanding basic arithmetic is a foundation for algebra.
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Skill Example:</strong> In cooking, knife skills and understanding heat are foundations for most recipes.
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Problem-Solving Example:</strong> Clearly defining the problem is a foundation for finding good solutions.
         </div>
       </div>
     </div>
   </div>

**Related terms:** Connection, Synthesis, Prerequisites

Meta-Learning
-------------

**Definition:** The practice of understanding and optimizing how you learn - "learning how to learn."

.. raw:: html

   <div class="glossary-entry">
     <div class="hint-container">
       <button class="hint-toggle" onclick="toggleHint('metalearning-examples')">Show Examples</button>
       <div class="hint-content" id="metalearning-examples" style="display: none;">
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Strategy Example:</strong> Recognizing that you learn better with visual aids and actively seeking diagrams and charts.
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Monitoring Example:</strong> Tracking which study methods lead to better retention and adjusting accordingly.
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Transfer Example:</strong> Applying successful learning strategies from one subject to a completely different domain.
         </div>
       </div>
     </div>
   </div>

**Related terms:** Self-Assessment, Transfer Learning, Expert Learning

Progressive Hints
-----------------

**Definition:** A system of providing help that starts with gentle guidance and gradually reveals more specific information, allowing learners to get just enough help without seeing full solutions immediately.

.. raw:: html

   <div class="glossary-entry">
     <div class="hint-container">
       <button class="hint-toggle" onclick="toggleHint('hints-examples')">Show Examples</button>
       <div class="hint-content" id="hints-examples" style="display: none;">
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Structure:</strong> Hint 1 (general direction) → Hint 2 (specific approach) → Solution (complete answer)
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Benefit:</strong> Maintains challenge level while preventing frustration and abandonment.
         </div>
         <div class="hint-level">
           <strong>Usage Tip:</strong> Try to solve with Hint 1 before looking at Hint 2. This builds problem-solving confidence.
         </div>
       </div>
     </div>
   </div>

**Related terms:** Scaffolding, Self
